title: Number of coral bleaching events

coral_bleaching.title: Coral bleaching
coral_bleaching.content: Corals contain microscopic algae that photosynthesize, providing corals with the majority of their energy. When exposed to warmer waters, corals can expel their algal symbionts, meaning they lose their source of energy. Without their algae, corals turn pale; causing them to look ‘bleached’. Several successive bleaching events can cause coral to die.

subtitle: The number of moderate (up to 30% of corals affected) and severe [coral bleaching](hover::biodiversity::coral_bleaching) events (more than 30% corals) measured at 100 fixed global locations. Bleaching occurs when stressful conditions cause corals to expel their algal symbionts.
